author: SPIKE77@aol.com
subject: review of Lupin- Alcatraz connection (spoilers)
body:
Hi:

I just have received a tape of the newest Lupin special , 'Alcatraz 
connection' that aired in Japan this past week.
I don't speak a word of japanese, so this is solely from visuals.

Note- SPOILERS!!!!



Well, for those of you who didn't like One Dollar Money wars ain't gonna like 
this one much either.
It has the same absurd sense of humor and story and lack of theatrical sense 
that the 2000 special had.
Though it is drawn MUCH better than the last film, the quality drops as the 
movie begins it's third act- almost as if they had to rush it to get the film 
done in time.

It sorta follows the story of Lupin and gang as they try to steal a ton of 
cash from a gambling seacruise and are thwarted by Zenigata (!)
Lupin puts a tracer on the cash and it leads to something about a crime 
organization that used to operate under Alcatraz prison in San Francisco, who 
were somehow involved with the assassination of JFK.

There is a cool cable car chase through the streets of San Francisco and 
everyone SEEMS to stay within character, but as always, it ends up in an 
underground city that gets destroyed at the end of the film.

Also similar to the last film, Lupin 'supposedly' dies. Though it's a cool 
dramatic vehicle, why use it on the very next TV special?

The worst part of the film was the ending . Once again set on an  street 
corner, our heroes are wearing summer clothes (short sleeves and SHORTS)
 including Goemon!!! He not only looks ridiculous but it isn't played for 
it's funny nature, he just happens to be wearing it.

Well, i'm pleased to see ANY Lupin film, but I think they should try to make 
these seem more like movies than TV episodes that just repeat situations 
constantly.

Steve
